com.samskivert.jdbc

Class DataSourceConnectionProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.samskivert.jdbc.DataSourceConnectionProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ConnectionProvider

    public class DataSourceConnectionProvider
extends Object
implements ConnectionProvider
    Provides connections using a pair of DataSource instances (one for read-only operations and one for read-write operations). Note: if transactions are going to be used, the data sources must be pooled data sources, otherwise bad things will happen.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DataSourceConnectionProvider(String url, DataSource readSource, DataSource writeSource)
      Creates a connection provider that will obtain connections from the supplied read-only and read-write sources.

    • Constructor Detail

      • DataSourceConnectionProvider

        public DataSourceConnectionProvider(String url,
                                    DataSource readSource,
                                    DataSource writeSource)
        Creates a connection provider that will obtain connections from the supplied read-only and read-write sources. The ident mechanism is not used by this provider. Responsibility for the lifecycle of the supplied datasources is left to the caller and is not managed by the connection provider (shutdown() does nothing).
        Parameters:
        url - a URL prefix that can be used by the DatabaseLiaison to identify the type of database being accessed by the supplied data sources, this should be one of "jdbc:mysql" or "jdbc:postgresql" as those are the only two types of database currently supported.

    • Method Detail

      • getConnection

        public Connection getConnection(String ident,
                                boolean readOnly)
                         throws PersistenceException
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionProvider
        Obtains a database connection based on the supplied database identifier. The repository expects to have exclusive use of this connection instance until it releases it. This connection will be released subsequently with a call to ConnectionProvider.releaseConnection(java.lang.String, boolean, java.sql.Connection) or ConnectionProvider.connectionFailed(java.lang.String, boolean, java.sql.Connection, java.sql.SQLException) depending on the circumstances of the release. close() will not be called on the connection. It is up to the connection provider to close the connection when it is released if appropriate.
        Specified by:
        getConnection in interface ConnectionProvider
        Parameters:
        ident - the database connection identifier.
        readOnly - whether or not the connection may be to a read-only mirror of the repository.
        Returns:
        an active JDBC connection (which may have come from a connection pool).
        Throws:
        PersistenceException - thrown if a problem occurs trying to open the requested connection.

      • releaseConnection

        public void releaseConnection(String ident,
                              boolean readOnly,
                              Connection conn)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionProvider
        Releases a database connection when it is no longer needed by the repository.
        Specified by:
        releaseConnection in interface ConnectionProvider
        Parameters:
        ident - the database identifier used when obtaining this connection.
        readOnly - the same value that was passed to ConnectionProvider.getConnection(java.lang.String, boolean) to obtain this connection.
        conn - the connection to release (back into the pool or to be closed if pooling is not going on).

      • connectionFailed

        public void connectionFailed(String ident,
                             boolean readOnly,
                             Connection conn,
                             SQLException error)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionProvider
        Called by the repository if a failure occurred on the connection. It is expected that the connection will be disposed of and subsequent calls to getConnection will return a freshly established connection to the database.
        Specified by:
        connectionFailed in interface ConnectionProvider
        Parameters:
        ident - the database identifier used when obtaining this connection.
        readOnly - the same value that was passed to ConnectionProvider.getConnection(java.lang.String, boolean) to obtain this connection.
        conn - the connection that failed.
        error - the error thrown by the connection (which may be used to determine if the connection should be closed or can be reused).

      • getTxConnection

        public Connection getTxConnection(String ident)
                           throws PersistenceException
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionProvider
        Returns a connection that can be used in a transaction. See ConnectionProvider.getConnection(java.lang.String, boolean). Note: transaction connections are never read-only. What would be the point?
        Specified by:
        getTxConnection in interface ConnectionProvider
        Throws:
        PersistenceException

      • releaseTxConnection

        public void releaseTxConnection(String ident,
                                Connection conn)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionProvider
        Releases a connection obtained by ConnectionProvider.getTxConnection(java.lang.String). See ConnectionProvider.releaseConnection(java.lang.String, boolean, java.sql.Connection).
        Specified by:
        releaseTxConnection in interface ConnectionProvider

      • txConnectionFailed

        public void txConnectionFailed(String ident,
                               Connection conn,
                               SQLException error)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionProvider
        Reports failure of a connection obtained by ConnectionProvider.getTxConnection(java.lang.String). See ConnectionProvider.connectionFailed(java.lang.String, boolean, java.sql.Connection, java.sql.SQLException).
        Specified by:
        txConnectionFailed in interface ConnectionProvider

      • getURL

        public String getURL(String ident)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionProvider
        Returns the URL associated with this database identifier. This should be the same value that would be used if ConnectionProvider.getConnection(java.lang.String, boolean) were called.
        Specified by:
        getURL in interface ConnectionProvider

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Description copied from interface: ConnectionProvider
        Shuts down this connection provider, closing all connections currently in the pool. This should only be called once all active connections have been released with ConnectionProvider.releaseConnection(java.lang.String, boolean, java.sql.Connection).
        Specified by:
        shutdown in interface ConnectionProvider
